articles.author: Mariya Gordeyeva
articles.description: An Embraer passenger plane flying from Azerbaijan to Russia crashed near the city of Aktau in Kazakhstan on Wednesday with 62 passengers and five crew on board, Kazakh authorities announced, saying that 27 people had survived.
articles.title: Passenger plane flying from Azerbaijan to Russia crashes in Kazakhstan with many feared dead

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's energy system and cities in its eastern region with cruise and ballistic missiles on Wednesday morning, Ukraine's energy minister and local officials said.
articles.title: Russia attacks Ukraine energy system in major missile strike, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Wednesday Israel has set new conditions that have led to delays in reaching a Gaza ceasefire agreement.
articles.title: Hamas says Israel's new conditions have delayed ceasefire agreement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The outgoing and incoming U.S. presidents had different messages for the Christmas holiday, with Democrat Joe Biden urging Americans to reflect and unite and Republican Donald Trump offering a holiday greeting and a flurry of politically focused social media posts.
articles.title: Biden, Trump send different Christmas messages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 200,000 homes across Bosnia and Herzegovina were without electricity for a second day on Wednesday, authorities said, after a snowstorm the day before caused widespread disruption across several Balkan countries.
articles.title: More than 200,000 homes without power in Bosnia after Balkan snowstorm

articles.author: Michael Holden, Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: King Charles thanked the medics who have cared for him and his daughter-in-law Kate, after they both underwent treatment for cancer this year, in a Christmas Day message that touched on global conflicts and the summer's riots in Britain.
articles.title: King Charles thanks medics for his and Kate's cancer care

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of university students rallied in Belgrade on Wednesday to protest the policies of President Aleksandar Vucic and his ruling Serbian Progressive Party (SNS), whom they blame for a railway disaster last month in which 15 people died.
articles.title: Serbian students march in Belgrade to protest train station disaster

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Libya's eastern-based government said in a statement on Wednesday that it had agreed on a proposal to end fuel subsidies and would prepare a mechanism to implement the agreement.
articles.title: Libya's eastern-based government agrees to proposal to end fuel subsidies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syrian police have imposed an overnight curfew in the city of Homs, state media reported, after unrest there linked to demonstrations that residents said were led by members of the minority Alawite and Shi’ite Muslim religious communities.
articles.title: Syrian police impose curfew in Homs after unrest

articles.author: Ank Kuipers
articles.description: Suriname's fugitive ex-President Desi Bouterse has died aged 79, the country's government said on Wednesday, almost a year after he fled authorities to avoid jail following his conviction over the murder of 15 political activists in 1982.
articles.title: Suriname ex-president Desi Bouterse dead at 79, foreign minister says
